subject: AI & Agents
title: Environmental Cost of Generative AI
description: A micro-lesson that makes Environmental Cost of Generative AI usable.

hook.text: Generating one image uses as much energy as charging your phone. Multiply by millions.

buildup.text: Training large generative models emits hundreds of tons of CO2 equivalent.

discovery.text: Inference costs add up: billions of API calls daily across all generative AI services.

twist.text: Efficiency improvements (distillation, quantization) offset some growth but usage scales faster.

climax.text: Measure and report compute costs. Choose efficient models when quality is comparable.

punchline.text: Every generation has a carbon cost. Make it count.

quiz.question: What contributes most to generative AI's environmental cost?
options: Billions of inference API calls daily
